intro: Xanthocephalum digynum, commonly known as the two-flowered goldenhead, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract various pollinators. Xanthocephalum digynum is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained environments.
